body.directions: Listen to the audio; then, complete the multiple-choice questions that follow.

body.quiz: Which of the following activities cannot be associated with the action indicated by the word in the audio?
body.correct: Job excellently done! 练习 liànxí means "to exercise/to practice," and we usually don’t practice the action of going to school, while we can practice skills such as speaking, singing, or drawing.
body.incorrect: Not quite…listen to the word in the audio again to understand its meaning, and then consider what type of activity does not require the action it indicates.

body.quiz: Which of the following is most likely seen at the class indicated by the word in the audio?
body.answer: Image of musical notes on a piece of sheet music ©iStock
options: Image of drawing pad and art supplies ©iStock
Image of calculator, pencil, and notebook©iStock
Image of PE class supplies ©iStock
body.correct: Terrific work! 音乐课 yīnyuèkè means "music class," where you will most likely see musical notes, which is indicated with the image you selected.
body.incorrect: Not quite…listen again several times to identify which class it is, and then consider what you might need for that particular class.

body.quiz: Which of the following does not have the same grammatical structure as the phrase in the audio?
body.answer: Audio for 我们 wǒmen
options: Audio for 唱歌 chànggē
Audio for 读书 dúshū
Audio for 画画 huàhuà
body.correct: You got it! 说话 shuōhuà (to talk/to speak (words)) is a verb + object unit, and so are the other phrases in the choices, except 我们 wǒmen (we/us), which is in the plural pronoun form.
body.incorrect: Oops…listen to the audio several more times to identify its meaning and grammatical form (consider verb + object structure), and then review all the choices to see which one does not have the same structure.

body.quiz: Which of the following sentences cannot be completed with the phrase in the audio?
options: 我很喜欢_____。 Wǒ hěn xǐhuān _____.
她姐姐每天_____。 Tā jiějie měitiān _____.
body.correct: Totally awesome! 唱歌 chànggē (to sing songs) can be used to form sentences "我很喜欢唱歌。 Wǒ hěn xǐhuān chànggē. (I like to sing.)"; "她姐姐每天唱歌。 Tā jiějie měitiān chànggē. (Her older sister sings every day.)"; and "我听他唱歌。 Wǒ tīng tā chànggē. (I listen to him sing.)." But it may not suit the 3rd structure "I am a little___," which should be followed by an adjective, not a verb or verb + object unit.
body.incorrect: Oops…listen to the audio several more times to identify its meaning; then place it with the sentences in the choices to see which one does not logically and grammatically fit.
